name: Search_Taxi

pick_up_place_id.description: The pick up location's place id. pick_up_place_id can be retrieved from api/v1/taxi/searchLocation(Taxi Search Location) endpoint in Taxi collection as googlePlaceId.

drop_off_place_id.description: The drop off location's place id. drop_off_place_id can be retrieved from api/v1/taxi/searchLocation(Taxi Search Location) endpoint in Taxi collection as googlePlaceId.

pick_up_time.description:
Pick up time
Format: HH:MM
Note: The format of time is 24 hours.

currency_code.description: The currency code. currency_code can be retrieved from api/v1/meta/getCurrency(Get Currency) endpoint in Hotels collection.

languagecode.description:
To obtain the response data in a specific language, enter the languagecode. languagecode can be retrieved from api/v1/meta/getLanguages(Get Languages
) endpoint in Meta collection.

dropOffLocation.description: Apollo Bandar, Colaba, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400001, India
dropOffLocation.name: The Taj Mahal Palace, Mumbai, Apollo Bandar, Colaba, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400001, India

pickupLocation.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (BOM), Mumbai, Maharashtra 400099, India

results.descriptionLocalised: Perfect for solo travellers, couples and small families.

response_summary:
The API response provides details about available transportation options from Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (BOM) in Mumbai to The Taj Mahal Palace, a journey covering approximately 29.12 kilometers and taking around 51 minutes. The pickup is scheduled for June 15, 2025, at 14:30.  

There are three vehicle options provided by E-Life Limo:  

1. **Standard** – Priced at $19.58, this option is ideal for solo travelers, couples, or small families, accommodating up to 3 passengers and 3 bags. It includes a meet-and-greet service and allows cancellations up to 24 hours before the ride.  

2. **People Carrier** – Costing $24.17, this larger vehicle can carry 4 passengers and 4 bags, making it a great choice for families. It also includes a meet-and-greet service and has the same 24-hour cancellation policy.  

3. **Executive** – At $27.50, this premium option offers extra comfort and space for 3 passengers and 3 bags. Like the others, it includes a meet-and-greet and can be canceled up to 24 hours in advance.  

All options are refundable and do not currently have any discounts applied. The vehicles are categorized as Standard, People Carrier, and Executive, with corresponding images provided for reference.
enhance_func_desc: This API is suitable for travelers needing airport transfers or point-to-point transportation. It searches available taxi options between specified pickup and drop-off locations, providing details like vehicle type, pricing, capacity, and cancellation policies. Users can filter by pickup date and time, and receive comprehensive ride information including passenger/bag limits and service inclusions. Location IDs must be obtained from the Taxi Search Location API.

enhanced_parameters.pick_up_place_id: Unique identifier for the pickup location, sourced from Taxi Search Location API.
enhanced_parameters.drop_off_place_id: Unique identifier for the drop-off location, sourced from Taxi Search Location API.
enhanced_parameters.pick_up_date: Date of pickup in YYYY-MM-DD format.
enhanced_parameters.pick_up_time: Time of pickup in 24-hour HH:MM format.
enhanced_parameters.languagecode: Language preference for the response data.

journeys.description: A list of journey details including pickup and drop-off locations.

ar_items.description: An object representing the details of a single journey.

requestedPickupDateTime.description: The scheduled pickup date and time for the journey, formatted as ISO 8601 (e.g., '2025-06-15T14:30:00').

city.description: The city where the drop-off location is situated (e.g., 'Mumbai').

latLng.description: The geographical coordinates of the drop-off location.

latitude.description: The latitude coordinate of the drop-off location (e.g., 18.9216631).

longitude.description: The longitude coordinate of the drop-off location (e.g., 72.8332028).

description.description: A detailed description of the drop-off location (e.g., 'Apollo Bandar, Colaba, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400001, India').

country.description: The country code of the drop-off location (e.g., 'IN').

isRideNowAvailable.description: Indicates whether an immediate ride is available at the drop-off location (e.g., false).

name.description: The full name of the drop-off location (e.g., 'The Taj Mahal Palace, Mumbai, Apollo Bandar, Colaba, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400001, India').

locationType.description: The type of the drop-off location (e.g., 'GEO').

postcode.description: The postal code of the drop-off location (e.g., '400001').

airportCode.description: The airport code if the drop-off location is an airport (e.g., null).

establishment.description: The name of the establishment at the drop-off location (e.g., 'The Taj Mahal Palace, Mumbai').

locationId.description: A unique identifier for the drop-off location (e.g., 'ChIJ____b8DR5zsRVz_XpIUEKcA').

janusSearchReference.description: A unique reference identifier for the journey search (e.g., 'ddea7ea5-7456-4e71-b752-14226e0d6e2a').

timezone.description: The timezone of the pickup location (e.g., 'Asia/Kolkata').

latLng.description: The geographical coordinates of the pickup location.

latitude.description: The latitude coordinate of the pickup location (e.g., 19.090176).

longitude.description: The longitude coordinate of the pickup location (e.g., 72.868696).

description.description: A detailed description of the pickup location (e.g., 'Mumbai, Maharashtra 400099, India').

isRideNowAvailable.description: Indicates whether an immediate ride is available at the pickup location (e.g., false).

name.description: The full name of the pickup location (e.g., 'Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (BOM), Mumbai, Maharashtra 400099, India').

locationType.description: The type of the pickup location (e.g., 'AIRPORT').

postcode.description: The postal code of the pickup location (e.g., '400099').

country.description: The country code of the pickup location (e.g., 'IN').

city.description: The city where the pickup location is situated (e.g., 'Mumbai').

establishment.description: The name of the establishment at the pickup location (e.g., 'Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (BOM)').

locationId.description: A unique identifier for the pickup location (e.g., 'ChIJRym9mVDI5zsRrqh0xGAazB4').

airportCode.description: The airport code of the pickup location (e.g., 'BOM').

results.description: A list of available transportation options for the journey.

ar_items.description: An object representing a single transportation option.

bags.description: The number of bags the vehicle can accommodate (e.g., 3).

drivingDistance.description: The distance of the journey in kilometers (e.g., 29.12).

descriptionLocalised.description: A localized description of the vehicle option (e.g., 'Perfect for solo travellers, couples and small families.').

price.description: The pricing details for the vehicle option.

currencyCode.description: The currency code for the price (e.g., 'USD').

amount.description: The price amount as a string (e.g., '19.58').

supplierId.description: The unique identifier for the supplier (e.g., 668).

resultId.description: A unique identifier for the transportation option (e.g., 'c939cecb-59c2-42e6-a149-05797c761e2e').

nonRefundable.description: Indicates whether the option is non-refundable (e.g., false).

duration.description: The estimated duration of the journey in minutes (e.g., 51).

legPriceBreakdown.description: A breakdown of the pricing for different legs of the journey.

ar_items.description: An object representing the price breakdown for a single leg.

supplierName.description: The name of the supplier for the leg (e.g., 'E-Life Limo').

supplierLocationId.description: The unique identifier for the supplier's location (e.g., 6189).

price.description: The pricing details for the leg.

currencyCode.description: The currency code for the price (e.g., 'USD').

amount.description: The price amount as a string (e.g., '19.58').

supplierId.description: The unique identifier for the supplier (e.g., 668).

journeyDirection.description: The direction of the journey leg (e.g., 'OUTBOUND').

janusResultReference.description: A reference identifier for the result (e.g., '1').

geniusDiscount.description: Indicates whether a genius discount is applied (e.g., false).

categoryLocalised.description: The localized category of the vehicle (e.g., 'Standard').

description.description: The description of the vehicle option (e.g., 'Standard').

imageUrl.description: The URL of the image representing the vehicle (e.g., 'https://cdn.rideways.com/images/cars/standard.jpg').

priceRuleId.description: The unique identifier for the price rule (e.g., 18738).

meetGreet.description: Indicates whether a meet-and-greet service is included (e.g., true).

priceBreakdown.description: A breakdown of the pricing details (e.g., empty array).

cancellationLeadTimeMinutes.description: The lead time in minutes before the ride can be canceled (e.g., 1440).

passengerCapacity.description: The number of passengers the vehicle can accommodate (e.g., 3).

supplierName.description: The name of the supplier (e.g., 'E-Life Limo').

depends_on.reason: The 'pick_up_place_id' parameter in the target API requires a Google Place ID for the pick-up location. The source API's response includes a 'place_id' field (e.g., 'ChIJaXQRs6lZwokRY6EFpJnhNNE') which is exactly what the target API needs. This is a direct match in terms of data type and purpose, as both APIs deal with location identification.

The 'pick_up_place_id' parameter in the target API requires a Google Place ID for the pickup location. The source API's response includes a 'googlePlaceId' field which exactly matches this requirement. This is a direct prerequisite for calling the target API, as the target API documentation explicitly states that the place ID must be obtained from this source API.

The 'drop_off_place_id' parameter in the target API requires a Google Place ID for the drop-off location. The source API's response includes a 'place_id' field (e.g., 'ChIJaXQRs6lZwokRY6EFpJnhNNE') which is exactly what the target API needs. This is a direct match in both data type and purpose, as the source API converts location names to Google Place IDs.

The 'drop_off_place_id' parameter in the target API requires a Google Place ID for the drop-off location. The source API's response field 'googlePlaceId' directly provides this information, matching both the data type and the required format. This is a clear case where the source API's response field can be used as input for the target API parameter.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a date in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. The source API's 'arrival_date' field provides exactly this format (e.g., '2025-06-10'). This creates a potential business association where a traveler might need a taxi to pick them up from the hotel on their arrival date.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a date in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. The source API's 'checkin' field in the 'stayed_room_info' object provides the check-in date in the same format (e.g., '2025-05-08'). This creates a potential business association where a traveler might need a taxi to pick them up from the hotel on their check-in date.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a date for taxi pickup. The source API's 'checkinDate' field in hotel properties provides the check-in date (e.g., '2025-06-10'), which matches the required format (yyyy-mm-dd). There is a potential business association where a traveler might need a taxi to reach the hotel on the check-in date.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a date in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD' for taxi pickup. The source API's 'departureDate' field provides exactly this format (e.g., '2025-06-11'). This creates a potential business association where a traveler might want to book a taxi for the same day as their flight departure.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a date in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD' for taxi pick-up. The source API's 'departureDate' field provides exactly this format (e.g., '2025-05-21'). This creates a potential business association where a traveler might want to book a taxi for the same day as their flight departure.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a specific date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format for taxi pickup. The source API's 'date' field in the response provides exact dates (e.g., '2025-05-20') which match the required format. This creates a potential business association where a traveler might want to book a taxi for the same date they check attraction availability.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a specific date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format for taxi pickup. The source API's 'avDates[*].date' field provides exact dates in the same format (e.g., '2025-06-10'). This creates a potential business association where a traveler might want to book a taxi for the same date they check out of their hotel.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format for taxi pickup. The source API's 'pickUpDate' field in the Car_Search API provides exactly this format and represents the date when a car rental is picked up. There is a potential business association where a traveler might need a taxi to reach the car rental location on the same date.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format for taxi pickup. The source API's 'departureTime' field in flight segments provides exact departure timestamps (e.g., '2025-06-15T06:00:00'). The date portion can be extracted from this timestamp to match the required format. This creates a potential business association where a traveler might want to book a taxi for the same day as their flight departure.

The 'pick_up_date' parameter in the target API requires a date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format for taxi pickup. The source API's 'departureTime' field in flight segments provides exact departure timestamps (e.g., '2025-05-25T01:00:00'). The date portion can be extracted from this timestamp to match the required format. This creates a potential business association where a traveler might need a taxi to the airport on the same day as their flight departure.

The 'pick_up_time' parameter in the target API requires a specific time for taxi pickup (24-hour format). The source API's '$.block[*].paymentterms.prepayment.info.time' field provides exact times (e.g., '00:00') which could be used to determine when a traveler might need a taxi after checking out of a hotel. This creates a potential business association where a traveler might need a taxi at the time of hotel check-out.

The 'pick_up_time' parameter in the target API requires a specific taxi pick-up time (24-hour format). The source API's 'arrivalTime' field in flight segments provides exact arrival timestamps (e.g., '2025-05-25T02:20:00'). While the data types differ (timestamp vs time), the time portion can be extracted. This creates a potential business association where a traveler wants to book a taxi after the flight arrives.

The 'pick_up_time' parameter in the target API requires a specific taxi pickup time (24-hour format). The source API's 'arrivalTime' field in flight segments provides exact arrival timestamps (e.g., '2025-06-15T07:55:00'). While the data types differ (timestamp vs time), the time portion can be extracted. This creates a potential business association where a traveler wants to book a taxi after the flight arrives.
